stages.name: security-layer
stages.description: Small barrier to entering private claim details. Known facts are used to verify that user should proceed.

versions.design-notes: A crude representation of a thin security layer that negates the need for a potentially sceptical user to enter too many details. An intentionally low barrier to allow defendants to view claim details whilst being mindful of security requirements.

pages.title: Enter claim details
pages.description: User enters the claim number to proceed to next step

pages.title: Request access code
pages.description: User enters their phone number, this is checked against the claim details. If there is a match, a 6 digit PIN is sent to the device

pages.title: Enter access code
pages.description: User enters the access code that was sent to their phone

versions.design-notes: First pass at the 'dashboard' layout for a defendant with access to all claim history, party information, current stage and next steps.

pages.title: Defendant dashboard - Writ of Control approved
pages.description: The status of the page when a Writ of Control has been approved

stages.name: stay-writ
stages.description: Application to set aside or vary County Court Judgment and implicitly submit High Court application to stay a Writ of Control

versions.design-notes: First pass at the process, focus on unifying the process of 'steming' the original CCJ and applying to the High Court to stay the Writ of Control. All questions driven by those asked on existing paper n244 form that require user input ie not present in judgment data

pages.title: What do you want to do?
pages.description: User indicates whether they wish to vary or set aside County Court Judgment

pages.title: What type of hearing do you want?
pages.description: User indicates the type of hearing they would like

pages.title: Why are you applying to cancel (set aside) your CCJ?
pages.description: User gives evidence to support claim to set aside CCJ. First iteration follows the n244 form which has a free-form textarea.

pages.title: Check your answers
pages.description: User verifies answers, is reminded of court fee and proceeds to GOV.UK Pay pages

pages.title: Application to set aside CCJ complete
pages.description: User is informed that the application has been successful and next steps are presented.

stages.name: check-writ
stages.description: Stand-alone mechanism to check validity of a court order including a Writ of Control and Warrant of Control

versions.design-notes: First pass at a simple, non-authenticated, fact-checking service to quickly determine the validity of a court document using GOV.UK

pages.title: Verify a court order
pages.description: Service start page that introduces the function of the service

pages.title: Verify a court order
pages.description: Known facts that are available on the Court Order document are requested to conduct a lookup

pages.title: Valid
pages.description: The status of the document is played back to the user
